intro: Pilosella lathraea, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has hairy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, spherical seed heads that are adapted for wind dispersal. Pilosella lathraea is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant.
